description: List prime factors of each number in order (each prime factor is followed by its power). Start with 1={1,1}.
comments: This entry also serves to show how to factor numbers in various languages.Memo: in Maple, use ifactors, not ifactor!For k=1..A001221(n): T(n,2*k-1)=A027748(n,k), T(n,2*k)=a124010(n,k); length of n-th row = 2*A001221(n). - _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Jan 10 2013
links: Reinhard Zumkeller, Rows n = 1..1000 of triangle, flattened
maple: for n from 2 to 256 do lprint(op(2..-1, ifactors(n))); od:
prog: (MAGMA) [ Factorization(n) : n in [1..120]];(PARI) for (n=2,256,print(factor(n))) [There has to be a better PARI code than this](Haskell)import Data.List (transpose)a035306 n k = a035306_row n !! (k-1)a035306_row 1 = [1,1]a035306_row n = concat $ transpose [a027748_row n, a124010_row n]a035306_tabf = map a035306_row [1..]-- _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Jan 10 2013
crossrefs: Cf. A008474 (row sums, apart from initial row).
author: _N. J. A. Sloane_.
